cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest through the Florida Straits, then turning north-northwest and north along the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend region before moving inland into Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Florida Big Bend (around Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL (north of Tampa area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River, and Storm Surge Warning from Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Florida Keys northward through the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely, with a 64% cumulative chance and peak onset probability of 47% Tuesday night into early Wednesday; gusts could exceed 60 mph if any strengthening occurs.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Warning in effect; 3–5 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with localized totals up to 8 inches could cause flash and urban flooding around the port Tuesday through Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes across the peninsula, dangerous seas and swells, and periods of very low visibility in heavy squalls may disrupt vessel movements and cargo handling.
